net.proteusframework.core.geo

Class RegionInformation

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.geo.RegionInformation

  • public abstract class RegionInformation
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides region / divisional information for a country. The regions returned are administrative or political regions like States, Provinces, Counties, Cities, etc.

    All ISO references refer to ISO 3166 for countries and ISO 639 for languages.

    ISO 3166 supports 3 different codes: 2-letter (digram), 3-letter (trigram), and numeric. Implementations must support at a minimum 2-letter codes.

    Example:

    System Property: -Dnet.proteusframework.core.geo.RegionInformation=com.xyz.MyRegionInformationImplementation

    SpringBean: <bean id="RegionInformation" class="com.xyz.MyRegionInformationImplementation"/>

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

      • getRegionCode

        @Nullable
public abstract java.lang.String getRegionCode(@Nullable
                                      java.lang.String isoLanguage,
                                      java.lang.String isoCountryCode,
                                      java.lang.String... regionCodeOrName)
        Return the region code for the specified regionName.
        Parameters:
        isoLanguage - optional language. If not specified, performance may suffer.
        isoCountryCode - the ISO country code.
        regionCodeOrName - the region path if known; otherwise only the name is required. At least one element (name) must be supplied.
        Returns:
        the region code or null if not found.

      • getRegionCodeOrName

        public java.lang.String getRegionCodeOrName(java.lang.String isoLanguage,
                                   java.lang.String isoCountryCode,
                                   java.lang.String... regionCodeOrName)
        Convenience method that calls getRegionCode(String, String, String...) and if it returns null, then this method returns the region name specified.
        Parameters:
        isoLanguage - optional language. If not specified, performance may suffer.
        isoCountryCode - the ISO country code.
        regionCodeOrName - if the region name being queried is within other regions, these can be specified to make the results more accurate and improve query performance.
        Returns:
        the code or if not found, the specified region name.
        See Also:
        getRegionCode(String, String, String...)

      • getRegionName

        public abstract java.lang.String getRegionName(java.lang.String isoLanguage,
                             java.lang.String isoCountryCode,
                             java.lang.String... regionCode)
        Get a region name in the specified language. If the name isn't available in the specified language then a name will be returned in an implementation default language.

        Example (implementation dependent):

        • getRegionName("en", "US", "NE") => Nebraska
        • getRegionName("en", "US", "NE", "001") => Adams County
        • getRegionName("fr", "US", "NE", "001") => Comt√© d'Adams

        Parameters:
        isoLanguage - the language.
        isoCountryCode - the ISO country code.
        regionCode - the region code(s). At least one region code must be provided.
        Returns:
        the name or the last specified region code if no name is found.

      • getSubRegionCodes

        public abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSubRegionCodes(java.lang.String isoCountryCode,
                                                 java.lang.String... regionCode)
        Get the sub-region codes for the specified country and regions.
        Parameters:
        isoCountryCode - the ISO country code.
        regionCode - optional list of regions.
        Returns:
        a mutable list of region codes.
